WorkItem.Description:
Hey all. Thx for the cool app..... just need some clarification on something...
 
I understand that with the 3.2.2 patch the block value of the Libram of Sacred Shield was increased.
 
The new libram tooltip states that it increases block value by 450 each time that Holy Shield is cast.
 
I noticed that in 2.2.19 i had to modify the value as it was still the old one, and that made me wonder why is it that the item is defined in the rawr db as increasing ShoR block value and not just plain BV?
 
And is it correct to choose the HolyShield option as the trigger? My goal is to check if LoSS finally outweighs Libram of Obstruction.

Comments.Message: Libram information from default itemcache.xml is no longer valid as of 2.2.19, and reloading it from armory or wowhead causes it to lose all stats, rendering it useless.  Need to fix parsing of this one.

Also, user is right, this shouldn't be under ShieldOfRighteousnessBlockValue, that's for a different libram effect.  This increases BlockValue, and probably should be contained in a SpecialEffect (even though uptime will be 100% in standard 969 rotation).
Ah awesome thank you roncli. Will modify the libram stats manually in the meantime! Good luck!

Just as another addition to my question earlier... in modifying the Libram of Obstruction.... is it safe to assume i can change the block value of 352 away from JudgementBlock onto pure block value in base stats?
Didn't see your question from before.  You can just refresh the item and the stats will be correct.
